text: New Changelog post: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/now-live-developer-accounts-updates-new-home-screen-and-added-security>  Mostly focused on API developers who use developer accounts, let me know if you have any uqestions

While not strictly developer related, thought folks here would find HubSpot’s new partnership with WP Engine interesting <https://medium.com/@HubSpot/why-HubSpot-is-partnering-with-wp-engine-ead92d96d81>

thank you for posting that.

honestly some of us have been confused the other way around - why WP engine would partner with HS. For HubSpot the reason makes perfect sense.

Personally, I’m a huge fan of the move, makes a ton of sense for us.  My guess (and I have no inside info on this) is that WP Engine looked around and there aren’t great free CRM offerings out there today and it’s really hard to build one so a partnership with HubSpot made sense

yea my thought was basically just surface level - HubSpot’s LeadIn tool and whatnot is designed to make people get more and more invested into the HubSpot Ecosystem and once you are so far in, it just makes sense to use the CMS and other tools too.

I guess though from WP Engine’s perspective - they’re maybe not interested in those larger companies and enterprises as much(requires more resources and a lot more work to provide a good enterprise service, this is something HubSpot excels at already), and are okay with them eventually moving to HubSpot

We’re also more than fine with people using Wordpress. It’s one of the nice things about moving to be a platform. If people don’t want to use our content tools but like the CRM, awesome. If people want to to use another service desk tool, but like our marketing suite, that’s cool too.  As long as we are helping people remove friction from their flywheel (and push harder at the right places) We’re pretty happy
Their gobbling up Flywheel was interesting… I guess this also helps them achieve their IPO goals too.
